lines.text: Don't fight any cops, Muggs. I t'ink dey got the law on their side.
He wants me to join the coppers' sewin' circle. Is that a laugh?
Hey, you'll get poison ivory.

[praising Muggs' fighting ability]
You're gettin' so good, you even got your shadow scared.

[at the police station]
We come to see Muggs McGinnis.
Now, isn't that nice! And did you bring flowers and candy?
Mmm, I got a rabbit's foot.
I brought dynamite.
I got a saw.
I got a machine gun.
Oh, you think you're smart. Maybe you'd like to stay here and spend a vacation.
These are officials from the reform school.
Young man, before we're through with you, you'll learn to have respect for authority.
So if you're the best example dey've got, I'll give ya odds.
Nice suit you're wearin', Monk.

[flatly]
It fits.

[imitating Danny]
Economics is a science of man's activities devoted to obtaining the material means for the satisfaction of his wants.

[impressed]
Where'd he learn that? He's absolutely illiterate!

[making a big to-do over moving in with Tom]
Friends, Romans and countrymen...
"Countrymen?" You know we're only city kids!

[smacks Limpy's head]
... lend me your ears and five bucks. It ain't what cha know, it's who ya know, and now dat I got a pull with the coppers, I'm gonna fix all your tickets for ya. It won't cost ya a penny, not one dime, and when I get through doin' that, I'm goooooooo...

[notices Tom standing behind him]
Well, um... Guess I'm caught in a trap, huh?
Hey, Slats, who wears your CLEAN collars?
Remember, pal, the water's deep, so you'd better keep swimming.

[taunting]
Hey, Muggs, don't forget. We got a date in just three hours.
In three hours and one minute you won't know nothin' about it.
Hey, you mean Danny needs blood?
That's right.
Well, why waste time? I'm FULL of blood.
